skill.name: migration-generator
skill.description: Create database migrations from model changes, schema diffs, and migration best practices.
skill.summary: Create database migrations from model changes, schema diffs, and migration best practices.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Contains only documentation and examples for database migration best practices. No network access, file system operations, or command execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Creating database migrations manually is error-prone and risky. This skill generates safe, reversible migration files following industry best practices for multiple frameworks and databases.
actual_capabilities: Generates forward and backward SQL migration files
Creates ORM-specific migrations for Prisma, TypeORM, Alembic, Django, and Rails
Includes rollback capability and safety warnings
Supports PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, and other databases
Offers data migration patterns for large tables
limitations: Does not execute migrations on actual databases
Does not connect to database servers
Does not read existing database schemas
Requires user to review and apply generated migrations

use_cases.title: Generate ORM migrations
use_cases.description: Create type-safe migrations for Prisma, TypeORM, Django, or Rails projects

use_cases.title: Write safe SQL scripts
use_cases.description: Generate reversible SQL migrations with proper transactions and rollback paths

use_cases.title: Plan zero-downtime deploys
use_cases.description: Design safe migration strategies for production databases with no service interruption

prompt_templates.title: Create users table
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a migration to create a users table with id, email, username, password_hash, active, created_at, and updated_at columns

prompt_templates.title: Add email column
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate an add_column migration for email_verified boolean with proper default value handling

prompt_templates.title: Create rollback
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a migration to rename password_hash column with zero downtime strategy and rollback path

prompt_templates.title: Data migration
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a batched data migration to backfill user roles from an enum set

output_examples.input: Generate a Prisma migration to add a UserProfile model with bio and avatar_url fields
output: Creates user_profiles table with proper foreign key to users
Review before applying: prisma migrate dev --name add_user_profile

best_practices: Always test migrations on staging environment before production deployment
Keep migrations small and focused on single logical changes
Include proper rollback migrations that can reverse all changes
anti_patterns: Never modify committed migrations - create new ones instead
Avoid long-running migrations without batching for large tables
Do not skip migrations or run them out of order

faq.question: Which databases are supported?
faq.answer: Supports PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, SQL Server, and MongoDB through various ORM frameworks.

faq.question: What is the maximum table size for migrations?
faq.answer: No limit. The skill provides batched migration patterns for tables with millions of rows.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing migration tools?
faq.answer: Generated migrations follow standard formats for Prisma, TypeORM, Alembic, Django, and other ORMs.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only generates code. No data is read, written, or transmitted. You review before applying.

faq.question: Why did my migration fail halfway through?
faq.answer: Check for constraint violations, locks, or syntax errors. The skill provides troubleshooting patterns.

faq.question: How is this different from ORM auto-migrate features?
faq.answer: Provides more control over migration timing, batching, and zero-downtime strategies than auto-migrate.
